clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing the Safety and Bioactivity of SG1002 in Heart Failure Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-blinded, Placebo-controlled Study to Assess the Safety and Bioactivity of Sodium Polysulthionate (SG1002) in Heart Failure Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safety and benefits of SG1002, including overcoming deficits in circulating hydrogen sulfide and nitrite found in heart failure patients, with secondary endpoints focused on improving clinical endpoints.

detailed_description.textblock: This will be a 3 month, placebo controlled double blind study, to determine whether 800 mg SG1002 given twice daily will be safe and will improve circulating levels of hydrogen sulfide and/or nitrite in heart failure subjects. In addition, secondary endpoints such as 6 minute walk distance, Minnesota heart failure questionnaire, biomarkers of inflammation and oxidative stress and cardiac remodeling will be assessed.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Composite measure using adverse events, clinical laboratory tests, vital signs and ECGs

Changes in blood levels of hydrogen sulfide and nitrite in the SG1002 group measured by comparing the area under the curves after administration of the first dose and baseline levels of each at the first visit versus the final visit.
primary_outcome.description: Demonstration of bioactivity as evidenced by increases in circulating levels of hydrogen sulfide and/or one or more nitric oxide metabolites, including nitrite, S-nitrosothiols and guanosine cyclic monophosphate levels as assessed by comparing AUC between placebo and SG1002 groups and by comparing baseline levels pre-administration at the start of the study to preadministration at the conclusion of the study.

secondary_outcome.description: A change from baseline to 13 weeks in BNP levels or cardiac remodeling as assessed by echocardiograms
A change from baseline to 13 weeks in waist circumference and body mass index

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers of inflammation and oxidative stress
secondary_outcome.description: A change from baseline to 13 weeks in biomarkers of inflammation, C-reactive Protein (CRP) and interleukin 6 (IL6) and oxidative stress, oxidized LDL (oxLDL) and ratio of reduced glytathione (GSH) to oxidized glutathione (GSSG)
A change from baseline to 13 weeks in the distance walked in 6 minutes
A change from baseline to 13 weeks in quality of life as assessed by Minnesota Heart Failure Questionnaire

arm_group.description: Capsules containing 400 mg of placebo will be provided to subjects. Subjects will take two tablets twice each day.
Capsules containing 400 mg of sodium polysulthionate (SG1002) will be provided to subjects. Subjects will take two tablets twice each day, providing subjects with 1600 mg SG1002 daily.
